italian.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, cook guanciale over medium heat until crispy and golden.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Pecorino Romano, Parmesan, and black pepper.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water before draining the spaghetti.
Add hot pasta to the skillet with guanciale and toss to combine.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture, adding pasta water gradually.
Toss until creamy and well combined. Serve immediately with extra cheese.

italian.name: Margherita Pizza
ingredients: Extra virgin olive oil for drizzling
instructions: Dissolve yeast in warm water and let stand for 5 minutes until foamy.
Mix flour and salt in a large bowl, create a well in the center.
Add yeast mixture and olive oil to the well, mix until a dough forms.
Knead for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic, then place in oiled bowl.
Cover and let rise for 1-2 hours until doubled in size.
Crush tomatoes by hand and season with salt and a pinch of sugar.
Divide dough into 2-3 portions, roll thin and top with sauce and mozzarella.
Bake at 250°C for 8-10 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.

italian.name: Risotto Milanese
ingredients: Salt and white pepper to taste
instructions: Heat stock in a saucepan and keep warm. Soak saffron in 2 tbsp warm stock.
Heat olive oil in a heavy-bottomed pan, sauté onion until translucent.
Add rice and stir for 2 minutes until grains are lightly toasted.
Pour in wine and stir until absorbed completely.
Add warm stock one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed.
Continue for 18-20 minutes until rice is creamy but still al dente.
Stir in saffron mixture, butter, and Parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper, serve immediately.

italian.name: Osso Buco
instructions: Season veal shanks with salt and pepper, dust with flour.
Heat oil in a heavy casserole, brown shanks on all sides.
Remove shanks and sauté vegetables until softened.
Add wine and reduce by half, then add tomatoes and stock.
Return shanks to pot, add bay leaves and bring to simmer.
Cover and braise in 160°C oven for 2-2.5 hours until tender.
Check occasionally and add more stock if needed.
Serve with gremolata and traditional risotto milanese.

italian.name: Tiramisu
instructions: Whisk egg yolks and sugar until thick and pale.
Beat in mascarpone until smooth and well combined.
Combine espresso and coffee liqueur in a shallow dish.
Quickly dip each ladyfinger in coffee mixture and arrange in dish.
Spread half the mascarpone mixture over the biscuits.
Repeat with another layer of dipped biscuits and remaining mascarpone.
Refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Before serving, dust with cocoa powder and add chocolate shavings.

asian.name: Pad Thai
instructions: Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft, then drain.
Mix tamarind paste, fish sauce, and palm sugar for the sauce.
Heat oil in a wok, scramble eggs and set aside.
Add tofu and prawns to wok, cook until prawns turn pink.
Add noodles and sauce, toss until noodles are coated.
Add bean sprouts and scrambled eggs, toss briefly.
Serve immediately with peanuts, lime wedges, and herbs.

asian.name: Chicken Teriyaki
instructions: Mix soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar for teriyaki sauce.
Heat oil in a pan, cook chicken skin-side down until crispy.
Flip chicken and cook until done, about 6-8 minutes total.
Remove chicken and add teriyaki sauce to pan.
Mix cornstarch with water and add to thicken sauce.
Return chicken to pan and coat with sauce.
Slice chicken and serve over rice with sesame seeds.

asian.name: Ramen
instructions: Simmer bones and chicken in water for 4-6 hours for rich broth.
Strain broth and season with miso and soy sauce.
Cook pork belly until tender, slice thin.
Prepare soft-boiled eggs and slice in half.
Cook ramen noodles according to package instructions.
Assemble bowls with noodles, pour hot broth over.
Top with pork, eggs, and vegetables.

asian.name: Sushi Rolls
instructions: Cook sushi rice and season with vinegar, sugar, and salt mixture.
Let rice cool to room temperature.
Place nori on bamboo mat, spread rice evenly leaving 1cm border.
Add fish and vegetables in a line across the rice.
Roll tightly using the mat, sealing the edge with water.
Cut into 6-8 pieces with a sharp, wet knife.
Serve with wasabi, ginger, and soy sauce.

asian.name: Korean Bibimbap
instructions: Marinate beef in soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil.
Blanch and season vegetables separately with sesame oil and salt.
Cook beef until done and set aside.
Fry eggs sunny-side up.
Arrange rice in bowls, top with vegetables, beef, and egg.
Serve with gochujang on the side.
Mix everything together before eating.

mexican.name: Tacos al Pastor
instructions: Toast chiles in a dry pan until fragrant, then soak in hot water.
Blend soaked chiles with garlic, onion, and achiote paste.
Marinate pork in chile mixture for at least 2 hours.
Cook pork in a hot pan until caramelized and cooked through.
Warm tortillas on a comal or dry pan.
Fill tortillas with pork, top with onion, cilantro, and pineapple.
Serve with lime wedges and your favorite salsa.

mexican.name: Guacamole
instructions: Cut avocados in half, remove pits and scoop flesh into a bowl.
Mash avocados with a fork, leaving some chunks for texture.
Add lime juice immediately to prevent browning.
Mix in onion, tomatoes, garlic, and jalapeños.
Add cilantro and season with salt to taste.
Let stand for 30 minutes to allow flavors to meld.
Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping.

mexican.name: Chicken Enchiladas
instructions: Preheat oven to 190°C and grease a baking dish.
Mix chicken with half the cheese, onion, and spices.
Warm tortillas to make them pliable.
Fill each tortilla with chicken mixture and roll tightly.
Place seam-side down in baking dish.
Top with enchilada sauce and remaining cheese.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Garnish with sour cream and cilantro before serving.

mexican.name: Chiles Rellenos
ingredients: 300g Monterey Jack cheese, cut into strips
instructions: Char poblanos over open flame until skins are blackened.
Place in plastic bag for 10 minutes, then peel off skins.
Make a small slit and remove seeds, stuff with cheese.
Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form, fold in yolks.
Coat chiles in flour, then dip in egg batter.
Fry in hot oil until golden brown on all sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve with warm tomato sauce.

mexican.name: Pozole Rojo
instructions: Simmer pork and bones in water for 2 hours until tender.
Remove meat, shred when cool, and strain broth.
Toast chiles, soak in hot water, then blend with garlic and onion.
Strain chile mixture and add to pork broth.
Add shredded pork and hominy to broth.
Simmer for 30 minutes, season with salt.
Serve with fresh garnishes and lime wedges.

mediterranean.name: Greek Moussaka
instructions: Slice eggplants, salt and let drain for 30 minutes.
Brush with olive oil and grill until golden.
Cook lamb with onion until browned, add tomatoes and wine.
Simmer for 30 minutes, season with cinnamon and oregano.
Layer eggplant and meat sauce in baking dish.
Top with béchamel sauce and cheese.
Bake at 180°C for 45 minutes until golden.
Rest for 10 minutes before serving.

mediterranean.name: Paella Valenciana
instructions: Heat olive oil in paella pan, brown chicken and rabbit.
Add vegetables and cook until tender.
Add grated tomato and cook until reduced.
Add rice and stir to coat with sofrito.
Add hot stock infused with saffron.
Simmer without stirring for 15-20 minutes.
Rest for 5 minutes before serving.
Garnish with lemon wedges and rosemary.

mediterranean.name: Falafel
instructions: Drain chickpeas and pat dry completely.
Pulse chickpeas in food processor until coarsely ground.
Add onion, garlic, herbs, and spices, pulse to combine.
Add flour and pulse briefly to bind.
Form mixture into small balls with damp hands.
Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
Serve with tahini sauce and pita bread.

mediterranean.name: Hummus
instructions: Reserve a few chickpeas for garnish.
Blend remaining chickpeas in food processor until smooth.
Add tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and cumin.
Blend until creamy, adding water if needed.
Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and lemon.
Transfer to serving bowl and drizzle with olive oil.
Garnish with reserved chickpeas and paprika.
Serve with warm pita bread.

mediterranean.name: Tzatziki
ingredients: Pita bread and vegetables for serving
instructions: Grate cucumbers and squeeze out excess moisture using kitchen towel.
Mix yogurt with minced garlic in a bowl.
Add drained cucumbers, olive oil, and vinegar.
Stir in fresh dill and season with salt and pepper.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to allow flavors to meld.
Adjust seasoning before serving.
Serve as a dip with pita bread and fresh vegetables.
Can also be used as a sauce for grilled meats.

indian.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and half the tikka paste for 2 hours.
Cook chicken in a hot pan until charred and cooked through.
In same pan, cook onion until soft and golden.
Add remaining tikka paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomatoes and simmer until reduced.
Add coconut milk and garam masala, simmer for 10 minutes.
Return chicken to sauce and heat through.
Garnish with coriander and serve with rice.

indian.name: Biryani
ingredients: 750g mutton or chicken, cut into pieces
1 tsp saffron soaked in warm milk
instructions: Marinate meat in yogurt and biryani masala for 2 hours.
Soak rice for 30 minutes, then boil with whole spices until 70% done.
Cook marinated meat until tender.
Layer rice and meat in heavy-bottomed pot.
Sprinkle fried onions, saffron milk, and herbs between layers.
Cover tightly and cook on high heat for 5 minutes.
Reduce heat and cook for 45 minutes on low heat.
Rest for 10 minutes before serving.

indian.name: Dal Tadka
instructions: Wash and cook lentils with turmeric until soft and mushy.
Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds until they splutter.
Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies, sauté briefly.
Add onion and cook until golden brown.
Add chopped tomatoes, cook until soft and oil separates.
Pour cooked lentils into the pan and mix well.
Simmer for 5 minutes and adjust seasoning.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

indian.name: Paneer Butter Masala
instructions: Heat butter in a pan, sauté onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste, cook until fragrant.
Add tomato puree, red chili powder, and cook until oil separates.
Add paneer cubes and mix gently.
Add cream, garam masala, and kasuri methi.
Simmer for 5 minutes and adjust seasoning.
Serve hot with naan or roti.

indian.name: Gulab Jamun
instructions: Mix khoya, flour, and baking soda to form a soft dough.
Make small balls and ensure no cracks.
Heat ghee in a pan, fry balls on low heat until golden brown.
Prepare sugar syrup with water, sugar, and cardamom powder.
Add fried balls to warm syrup and let soak for 1 hour.
Serve warm or chilled as desired.

american.name: Cheeseburger
instructions: Season ground beef with salt and pepper, form into 4 patties.
Heat a grill or skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook patties for 3-4 minutes per side until desired doneness.
Place a slice of cheese on each patty during the last minute of cooking.
Toast burger buns lightly on the grill.
Assemble burgers with lettuce, tomato, onion, and sauces.
Serve hot with fries or coleslaw.

american.name: Buffalo Wings
ingredients: Celery sticks and blue cheese dip for serving
instructions: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 180°C.
Season wings with salt and pepper, fry in batches until crispy and golden.
In a saucepan, melt butter and mix with hot sauce, honey, and vinegar.
Toss fried wings in sauce until coated evenly.
Serve immediately with celery sticks and blue cheese dip.

american.name: Apple Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C.
Toss apple slices with sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and lemon juice.
Line a pie dish with one crust, fill with apple mixture, and dot with butter.
Cover with second crust, seal edges, and cut small slits for steam.
Brush top crust with egg wash.
Bake for 45-50 minutes until golden brown.
Cool slightly before serving with vanilla ice cream.

american.name: Clam Chowder
instructions: Cook bacon in a large pot until crispy, remove and set aside.
Add butter to pot and sauté onion and celery until soft.
Add potatoes and clam juice, simmer until potatoes are tender.
Stir in clams and cream, cook for 5 minutes until clams open.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with parsley and bacon bits.
Serve hot with crusty bread.

american.name: Pancakes
ingredients: Maple syrup and fresh berries for serving
instructions: Whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, mix buttermilk, egg, and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, stir until just combined.
Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat, lightly grease with butter.
Pour batter onto skillet, cook until bubbles form on surface, flip and cook other side.
Serve warm with maple syrup and berries.
